snippet: Puerto Rico’s extended woes, including high unemployment and pervasive crime, are causing a worrisome exodus of professionals and middle-class residents to places like Florida and Texas.
abstract: Puerto Rico's extended woes, including high unemployment, soaring cost of living, pervasive crime and crumbling schools, are causing a worrisome exodus of professionals and middle-class residents to places like Florida and Texas; situation has grown so dire that the island is sometimes likened to Detroit, with the significant difference that Puerto Rico cannot declare bankruptcy.
lead_paragraph: Puerto Rico’s extended woes, including high unemployment and pervasive crime, are causing a worrisome exodus of professionals and middle-class residents to places like Florida and Texas.

headline.main: Economy and Crime Spur New Puerto Rican Exodus
headline.print_headline: Economy and Crime Spur New Puerto Rican Exodus
